p: At admission, over two-thirds (69.8%; 227/325) presented with lymphopenia; 67.1% (218/325) with an elevated blood glucose level. Over half (56.5%; 182/322) had increased C-reactive protein (CRP); 38.8% (126/325) had elevated D-dimers; a quarter had leukocytopenia (25.2%; 82/325) or raised procalcitonin (PCT) (25.6%; 84/325); and 17.2% (56/325) had hypokalemia. Patients with CD4 + T-lymphocyte count <200/mm 3 and <500/mm 3 accounted for 10.2% (33/325) and 58.8% (191/325) of cases, respectively ( Table 2). In chest CT scans, most (97.5%; 314/322) revealed typical pneumonia and ground-glass opacification (93.5%, 301/322), and less than half (42.9%, 138/322) had bilateral lung involvement. Pleural thickening was found in 64.9% (209/322) of scans.
